background.name: Clown
entries: You are skilled in the art of the clown. You might use your talent to earn money, make others laugh, or even for your own amusement. You may entertain using good-natured humor or make jokes at the expense of others. Whether you ran away and joined a traveling carnival or were lured into the job by a fey, you are a clown that no one will forget.

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: {@item Disguise Kit| phb} and {@item Playing Card Set| phb}

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: {@item entertainer's pack | phb}, playing cards, props for your act (balls to juggle, handkerchiefs, noise makers, or puppets), a set of traveler's clothes, and a pouch containing 10 gp

entries.name: Feature: Clowning Around
entries: Whether it's juggling, acrobatics, or otherwise clowning around, you can entertain almost anywhere you go. You may perform on the street to earn gold or work as an entertainer under the employ of others. You have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) and Charisma ({@skill Performance}) checks made in front of or to grab the attention of a crowd. Additionally, you may be part of a network of clowns or other carnival performers.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Clowns are out in front of the crowds, drawing attention and entertaining the people. They can be colorful, surprising, and even deceptive. Offstage, a clown's personality may be equally silly or quite the opposite. Sometimes behind the big smile lies an insecurity or a secret. Use the following tables to develop your clown or inspire your own design.

rows: I prefer to be a clown at all times. I wear my make-up and costume even when I don't have to.
I am mischievous in and out of make-up. I play practical jokes and tricks whenever I can.
I am surprisingly shy, but when i put on the clown make-up, I become someone else.
Even though I make others giggle, I don't find much funny in real life. You rarely hear me laugh.
I am obsessed with improving my craft. When I travel to new places, I look for things I can incorporate into my act.
I seek attention whether I am in costume or out. I want all eyes on me.

No one understands that clowning is an art form. I try to
improve my work and educate others about its importance.

I hate being a clown but I don't know what else to do with
myself. It feels like it is my only talent
Charity. Sometimes I entertain just to bring light to the darkness. No need to pay me. (Good)
Respect. People should respect artists. I will do what I can to make sure we are seen as equals in society. (Lawful)
Humor. I will do anything for a laugh. I don't care about the consequences. (Chaotic)
Deception. I will distract you with my antics so that I may take from you what I will. (Evil)
People. I like to be among others. Some of them won't smile no matter what I do, but I still try. (Neutral)
Solitude. The chaos of performance and the attention can be draining. I value silence and solitude. (Any)
The props I use in my act have been handed down to me by people that I lost along the way.
I am proud of a particular trick I invented for my act. I want to train other clowns on how to do it.
I have a soft spot for other clowns and performers. If they ask for something, I will gladly give it.
There is someone I've always wanted to perform for. I will make sure I do before I die.
The person who taught me how to paint my face is very special to me. I would do anything for them.
I seek magic that I can use in my act. I want the crowds to believe I am the best clown in the world.
I can't help myself. Even when people tell me they don't appreciate my practical jokes, I still play them.
When I am wearing my costume, my attention span and listening skills are not that great. I'm too focused on entertaining others.
I'm not the most careful, especially when performing. I've injured myself and others in the past.
I laugh at inappropriate times since my mind is trained to look for the humor in everything.
When it comes to work-for-hire, I am very distrustful. I've been burned in the past.
I am losing myself in my art. I don't know where the clown ends and I begin.

background.name: Dreamer
entries: Every time you sleep, you dream. Your dreams are incredibly realistic and sometimes contain portents of the future. Whether these dreams are a result of a trip to the Feywild or you were born this way, they are a part of you that you cannot ignore. You don't always remember exact details of your dreams, but rather fragments and images. While it feels like your dreams hint at the future, not everyone believes you. You struggle with who to tell about your dreams and what they mean

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: One type of {@filter artisan's tools | items}

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: {@filter Artisan's tools | items} (chosen above), one trinket of special significance, a set of common clothes, an item normally used for divination (a small crystal, animal bones, or a mirror), a journal to record your dreams, and a belt pouch containing 12 gp.

entries.name: Feature: Dream Vision
entries: You may influence your dreams. Perhaps you'd like to dream about an upcoming adventure, a newfound love, or a magic item—the possibilities are endless. Prior to taking a long rest, tell your DM the topic you would like to dream about. After you finish a long rest, use the Dream Results table to determine what kind of dream you had.

rows: You don't remember your dream or it was mundane.
You remember your dream. It was scary or entertaining, but not prophetic.
Your dream felt prophetic.

entries: On a roll of 5 or higher, your DM describes your dream to you and whether you feel "good" or "bad" about it. At your DM's discretion, what you remember from your dream could be a single image, a short fragment, or a detailed moment. Although the dream felt prophetic, it may or may not have been truly predictive.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries:
Dreamers come from all walks of life with varied
motivations. Use these tables to further define your dreamer or to inspire a dreamer of your creation with your DM's input.

rows: I am obsessed with my dreams and talk about them a lot.
I ask others about their dreams and offer dream interpretation without being asked.
I tend to daydream a lot. People ask me if I am paying attention because my mind seems to be elsewhere.
Even my mundane dreams seem prophetic to me. I see signs and portents in everything.
My dreams are so realistic, I sometimes get confused as to whether I'm dreaming or awake.
I can't shake my nightmares. If I have one, I am grumpy and irritable until I sleep again.
I believe my dreams are useful, but I only share them with those I trust.
I am fascinated with learning how to control my dreams. I would do almost anything to achieve that.
Positivity. Even bad dreams can be good. I speak about the bright side of all things. (Good)
Acceptance. People should respect those who dream the future. I am determined to make it accepted. (Lawful)
No Fear. I'm not afraid of much. My dreams will warn me if I should be worried. (Chaotic)
Exploit. I take advantage of people who believe my dreams are predictive. I will lie if it suits me. (Evil)
Encouragement. I encourage people to follow their dreams and to not let anyone stand in the way. (Neutral)
Understanding. I want to know why I have these dreams and maybe how to stop them. (Any)
I have a recurring dream that haunts me.
I carry divination tools and try to learn new methods to enhance what I learn from my dreams.
There is a dream I had of a person years ago. It has stuck with me. I hope one day we will meet.
My journal contains all of my important dreams. I don't want anyone to read it.
I once dreamt of a trinket. I found it the next day. Now, it's one of my most prized possessions.
I have a friend who also dreams of the future. We help each other deal with this gift.
I don't always think before I speak. I say things that might upset people, especially if it was in a dream.
I assume everyone cares or should care about my dreams. I insist that you listen.
People think I'm depressed sometimes, but it's just that I prefer my dreams to reality.
I hate that I see things in my dreams. I try to ignore it sometimes or even avoid sleeping.
As if seeing the future in dreams wasn't enough, I also have night terrors.
I insist that my dreams' predictions are correct, even when they're not.
